stream_context.summary: Kaze streams level-building and polishing work, finishing Course 1 and focussing on Course 14.  He updates visuals (new HUD font, bridge texture, googly-eyed enemies), experiments with performance fixes, and redesigns a mission around a wing-cap freedom concept, modelling props like a paper airplane and bubble-blower targets live on stream.

development_findings.summary: Course 1 is now considered complete after a final round of visual and gameplay tweaks.
development_findings.quote: Course 1 genuinely has the final rework done now.

development_findings.summary: Work shifted to Course 14, which contains five biome areas that fade between Badub’s music layers and now features googly-eyed thimble enemies.
New HUD font with semi-transparent pixels reduces pixelation; Biobak supplied textures and Kaze changed code to support them.
development_findings.quote: If you look closely at the font now, the font is much less pixelated.

development_findings.summary: Bridge texture in Bunny Brush Woods judged ‘unfitting’; Kaze prototypes gradient and combiner tricks to make a wooden plank variant, illustrating iterative art direction.
development_findings.quote: The old one is just way too unfitting. Doesn’t fit the art-style.

development_findings.summary: Fixed mushroom caps that rotated the wrong way, demonstrating quick in-engine bug repair.
development_findings.quote: You’re right, they’re rotating the wrong way – let me fix it real quick.

development_findings.summary: Performance check on real hardware shows Course 14 still hits ~50 fps; overdraw and large meshes will be culled and re-sorted for speed.
development_findings.quote: Considering we didn’t optimise anything at all yet, it’s actually decent.

development_findings.summary: Mission overhaul: replaces stiff ‘paper airplane collect 5 silver stars’ idea with a late-game Wing-Cap mission that emphasises freedom and contrast.  Concepts include X-marks secrets, timed switch star, and using cannons to regain momentum.
development_findings.quote: By having a strong contrast between non-free and free parts, the freedom is going to feel more freedom.

development_findings.summary: Introduced ‘paper targets’ suspended in bubble-blowers as obstacles/rings the player can fly through; will swap static and animated models so the target rips when hit.
development_findings.quote: We want it to be able to rip, so it needs some tension.

development_findings.summary: Live-modelled a mathematically accurate paper airplane prop using Blender as a future vehicle or scenery element.
Flight camera auto-rotate bug diagnosed; Kaze adjusts flags so the camera now follows pitch correctly when flying.
development_findings.quote: This camera is totally wrong… this should be a lot better.

context_findings.summary: Kaze ranks himself ‘7/10 designer’ and encourages chat to challenge his ideas, showing openness to critique.
context_findings.quote: Just because I say things doesn’t mean they’re necessarily true.

context_findings.summary: Design philosophy rejects purposeless collect-athons; each star must add to freedom, immersion, or learning.
context_findings.quote: Why would someone want to do a mission that’s just walk everywhere, idiot?

context_findings.summary: Jokes about Nintendo legal action, signalling a defiant but humorous stance on potential takedowns.
context_findings.quote: Nintendo should be scared I attack headquarters.

biobak.summary: Provided the new, smoother HUD font textures and is expected to rework Course 14 visuals in a way that historically improves both looks and performance.
biobak.quote: Somehow every time Biobak reworks the levels, he improves the performance despite adding a shit-ton of stuff.

badub.summary: Composed multiple layered tracks for Course 14; uploads them quickly to SoundCloud and uses instrument cross-fading to match biomes.
badub.quote: Oh my god, Badub made so many new songs… the instruments fade into each other depending on which area you walk to.

zeina.summary: Tasked with replacing the temporary grind-blur icon; also produced recent animations such as the crouch-and-lean grind animation.
zeina.quote: I already asked Zeina to make a new icon; the current icon is completely temporary.

key_stories.title: From Airplane to Wing Cap
key_stories.summary: Kaze scraps a rigid silver-star airplane ride and replaces it with a late-act Wing-Cap mission that lets players freely traverse Course 14.
key_stories.challenge: Original concept felt ‘stiff’ and didn’t deliver a sense of freedom.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed with chat: wing-cap appears only in Act 5/6, secret X spots, use of cannons, or timed switch.
key_stories.outcome: Committed to Wing-Cap design; next steps are placing boxes, landmarks and designing targets.
key_stories.key_quote: I much prefer that over the paper airplane – the whole level suddenly opens up because you have the Wing Cap.

key_stories.title: Bridge Texture Crisis
key_stories.summary: A bridge in Bunny Brush Woods looked out of place.  Kaze live-tests gradients, RGB combiners and alternate woods to blend with the environment.
key_stories.process: Iterated multiple Photoshop edits, in-game previews, and chat polls.
key_stories.outcome: Settled on an improved gradient-based plank texture; may still search for something ‘between both’.
key_stories.key_quote: Would you rather just have the worse level?

key_stories.title: Paper Airplane Origami Modelling
key_stories.summary: Needing an accurate paper plane prop, Kaze mathematically folds a virtual sheet in Blender, debating millimetre-perfect ratios with chat.
key_stories.challenge: Wanted believable origami within N64 UV limits.
key_stories.process: Calculated folds (22.5° angles, UV mirroring) and built IA8 graph-paper texture.
key_stories.outcome: Finished low-poly model saved for Course 14 use.
key_stories.key_quote: Look at this beautiful fold – it looks just like a real paper airplane now.

open_questions.context: Multiple ideas floated (X-marks secrets, timed switch, ring targets) but no definitive design chosen.
questions: Which mechanic will you lock in for the Wing-Cap mission?
How will you balance freedom with clear objectives?

open_questions.context: Prototype built; Biobak offered to make improved model with trampoline-like ring and ripping animation.
questions: What materials and style will the final target use?
Who will handle animation rigging and N64 bone restrictions?

open_questions.context: Chat suggested a cardboard fortune-teller piranha plant enemy; Kaze liked idea but only jotted a note.
questions: Will this enemy be implemented and what gameplay purpose will it serve?
How will the fortune-telling gimmick manifest in-game?

open_questions.context: Current build runs ~50 fps but overdraw and 5 k-poly mountains concern Kaze.
questions: What specific culling and material sorting steps are planned?
Will additional hardware tests be done after Biobak’s rework?

open_questions.context: Kaze states the hub world ‘is going to happen at the very end’ with no details yet.
questions: What narrative or functional role will the hub world play?
How will its art style tie together the diverse course themes?
